Class Entity

java.lang.Object
sk.stuba.fiit.GameObject
sk.stuba.fiit.entities.Entity
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, Damageable, Mortal
Direct Known Subclasses:
Player, Projectile, Spawner
public abstract class Entity extends GameObject implements Damageable, Mortal
Abstract class representing an entity in the game world. Entities can be damageable, have health, and may die. They also have a collider for collision detection.

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity(String name, String description, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture texture, int health, int maxHealth)
      Constructs a new entity with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the entity.
      description - a description of the entity.
      texture - the texture to represent the entity.
      health - the initial health of the entity.
      maxHealth - the maximum health of the entity.
      Throws:
      InvalidParameterInitializationException - if the health or max health parameters are invalid.

  • Method Details

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Gets the current health of the entity.
      Returns:
      the current health of the entity.

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth(int health)
      Sets the health of the entity. If the health is set to a value greater than the maximum health, it will be set to the maximum health. If health is set to a negative value, it will throw an exception.
      Parameters:
      health - the new health value to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the health is negative.

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      Gets the maximum health of the entity.
      Returns:
      the maximum health of the entity.

    • setMaxHealth

      public void setMaxHealth(int maxHealth)
      Sets the maximum health of the entity. If the new maximum health is less than the current health, the current health will be set to the new maximum health. If the maximum health is set to a value less than zero, it will throw an exception.
      Parameters:
      maxHealth - the new maximum health value to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the maximum health is less than zero.

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks if the entity is alive.
      Returns:
      true if the entity is alive, false otherwise.

    • setAlive

      public void setAlive(boolean alive)
      Sets the alive status of the entity.
      Parameters:
      alive - the new alive status of the entity.

    • getCollider

      public Collider getCollider()
      Gets the collider of the entity.
      Returns:
      the collider of the entity.

    • setCollider

      public void setCollider(Collider collider)
      Sets the collider of the entity.
      Parameters:
      collider - the new collider to set for the entity.

    • onCollision

      public abstract void onCollision(Entity collisionEntity)
      Abstract method to handle the logic when the entity collides with another entity. The concrete implementation of this method should define how the entity reacts to a collision.
      Parameters:
      collisionEntity - the entity that this entity has collided with.
